name: esszone_sulu_sea_operational_data
description: Eastern Sabah Security Zone operational geodata — bases, patrol zones, transit corridors, and key locations for Sulu Sea / Celebes Sea simulation

properties.name: ESSZONE Boundary
properties.description: Eastern Sabah Security Zone — Kudat to Tawau, 10 districts. Established 25 March 2013.

properties.name: ESSZONE Sector 1 — Kudat / Pulau Banggi
properties.description: Northern sector covering Kudat, Kota Marudu, Pitas. Pulau Banggi forward operating area.

properties.name: ESSZONE Sector 2 — Sandakan
properties.description: Central sector covering Sandakan, Beluran, Kinabatangan. MAWILLA 2 HQ.

properties.name: ESSZONE Sector 3 — Lahad Datu / Kunak
properties.description: Southern-central sector. Site of 2013 Lahad Datu standoff. Helicopter FOB.

properties.name: ESSZONE Sector 4 — Semporna
properties.description: High-threat sector. Dense island cluster 18km from Philippines. Primary kidnapping-for-ransom area.

properties.name: ESSZONE Sector 5 — Tawau / Sebatik
properties.description: Southernmost sector. Tawau Maritime Command Centre. Pulau Sebatik split with Indonesia.

properties.name: Sulu Sea Transit Corridor
properties.description: Designated safe shipping corridor through the Sulu Sea. Vessels must notify Maritime Command Centre 24 hours in advance.

properties.name: Sibutu Passage
properties.description: Critical sea lane between Borneo and Sulu Archipelago. Major smuggling and piracy corridor.

properties.name: Semporna Island Cluster
properties.description: Dense cluster of islands including Sipadan, Mabul, Kapalai, Ligitan. Tourism and fishing area. Historically targeted by Abu Sayyaf.

properties.name: Common Illegal Fishing Areas — Sulu Sea
properties.description: Areas frequently encroached by foreign fishing vessels (Philippines, Vietnam, China)

properties.name: MAWILLA 2 — RMN Sandakan (Sea Area 2 HQ)
properties.description: Royal Malaysian Navy Eastern Fleet patrol coordination. G2000 Mk II Fast Interceptor Craft stationed here.

properties.name: RMN Semporna Naval Detachment
properties.description: Naval patrol station at Semporna. Fast patrol boats and intercept craft.

properties.name: RMN Tawau Naval Base
properties.description: Naval base at Tawau. Part of Trilateral Maritime Command Centre.

properties.name: RMN Lahad Datu Naval Station
properties.description: Naval station established after 2013 Lahad Datu standoff.

properties.name: KD Sri Sepanggar — RMN Eastern Fleet HQ
properties.description: RMN Eastern Fleet Headquarters. Major warships, corvettes. Kota Kinabalu area.

properties.name: RMAF Labuan Air Base
properties.description: RMAF base on Labuan island. Maritime patrol aircraft, transport aircraft. Closest RMAF base to ESSZONE.

properties.name: Lahad Datu Helicopter FOB
properties.description: Helicopter forward operating base. Capacity for 6 helicopters. EC725, Blackhawk staging.

properties.name: ESSCOM Headquarters — Lahad Datu
properties.description: Eastern Sabah Security Command joint headquarters. Coordinates all ESSZONE agencies.

properties.name: ESSCOM Fusion Centre (EFC)
properties.description: Joint intelligence and surveillance centre. AI-enhanced border surveillance.

properties.name: Tawau Maritime Command Centre
properties.description: Part of Trilateral Cooperative Agreement. Coordinates with Philippines (Bongao) and Indonesia (Tarakan).

properties.name: MMEA Sandakan Maritime Station
properties.description: MMEA station for central ESSZONE waters.

properties.name: MMEA Semporna Maritime Station
properties.description: MMEA station covering Semporna waters and Sibutu Passage approaches.

properties.name: MMEA Tawau Maritime Station
properties.description: MMEA station at Tawau. Fuel smuggling interdiction.

properties.name: MMEA Kudat Maritime Station
properties.description: MMEA station covering northern ESSZONE and Pulau Banggi.

properties.name: RMP General Operations Force (GOF) — Sandakan
properties.description: GOF brigade for ESSZONE. Paramilitary police force for jungle and border operations.

properties.name: RMP Marine Police — Semporna
properties.description: Marine police unit. Rigid hull fender boats with FLIR night vision.

properties.name: 1st Infantry Division HQ — Kota Kinabalu
properties.description: Malaysian Army 1st Infantry Division. Primary ground force for Sabah.

properties.name: Malaysian Army — Tawau Camp
properties.description: Army garrison at Tawau. Infantry, Malay regiment.

properties.name: Immigration & Customs — Tawau Port
properties.description: Major customs and immigration checkpoint. Cross-border trade with Nunukan, Indonesia.

properties.name: Immigration & Customs — Sandakan Port
properties.description: Customs and immigration at Sandakan port.

properties.name: Pulau Sipadan
properties.description: World-famous dive site. Scene of 2000 Abu Sayyaf kidnapping. Now heavily guarded.

properties.name: Pulau Mabul
properties.description: Tourism island near Sipadan. Forward Operating Base under construction.

properties.name: Pulau Banggi
properties.description: Malaysia's largest island. Northern ESSZONE. Coastal radar installation. Tactical floating barge planned.

properties.name: Pulau Sebatik
properties.description: Island split between Malaysia and Indonesia. Smuggling corridor. Fibre optic system planned.

properties.name: Coastal Surveillance System Radar Network
properties.description: 13 radar stations from Pulau Banggi to Tawau. Includes Airbus SPEXER 2000 (250km range).
